title: Girl dies in shooting in apparent murder-suicide attempt at her home in Howard County
content:
ELLICOTT CITY, Md. (ABC7) — A girl is dead and a male is in critical condition after a triple shooting in a home early Sunday morning in Ellicott City.
Police are calling the incident an attempted murder-suicide.
Howard County Police say Suzanne Zaremba, 52, went into her 16-year-old daughter Charlotte Zaremba's room in their home in the 4800 block of Knoll Glen Road around 2:00 a.m. after hearing a scuffle. Suzanne went in and saw a unknown male in the room with her daughter.
The male then shot Suzanne and Charlotte before turning the gun on himself, according to police.
Charlotte was taken to Howard County General Hospital where she was pronounced dead.
Suzanne was taken to Shock Trauma with non-life threatening injuries but has since been released.
The shooter is still in Shock Trauma in critical condition. Police say he is a 15-year-old Ellicott City resident, but are not releasing his name. Police do not know his connection to the Zaremba family at this time.
Police are asking anyone with information on the shooting to contact them at 410-313-STOP or HCPDcrimetips@howardcountymd.gov.
